never.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: not at any time, or not once
never.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I’m never going back there again, not as long as I live.
It is never too late to give up smoking.
Never again (=never after a particular time) would he return to Naples.
Never had she been so confused.
I’ll never ever forgive him for leaving me.
Never in all my life have I felt so humiliated.
She had never for one moment imagined that it could happen to her.
Max had never been known to leave home without telling anyone.
somebody/something has never been known to do something
never.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0: Never usually comes before a verb
I never get to bed before 11
Never I get to bed before 11
never.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1: Never usually comes after the verb ‘be’
never.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2: You sometimes use never before ‘be’ to emphasize that two statements are connected
‘Sarah was late that day’ ‘I’m not surprised She never was on time!’
never.translation[0].note_box[0].items[3: Never usually comes after the auxiliary
never.translation[0].note_box[0].items[4: You sometimes use never before an auxiliary to emphasize that two statements are connected
I don’t enjoy football I never have liked sports
never.translation[0].note_box[0].items[5: In writing, you can use never at the beginning of a sentence before an auxiliary to emphasize something
Never had she been so confused
never.translation[0].note_box[1].section: never
not at any time, or not once
Ali had never seen snow before.
I’ll never forget that day.
never ever
used to emphasize that you mean never
Do you promise never ever to tell anyone else about this?
not once
used to emphasize that you are surprised or annoyed because someone never did something
She’s never said thank you – not once.
Jo hasn’t emailed me once in six months.
not/never for a moment
used to emphasize that you never had a particular thought or idea
‘Did you ever suspect he was cheating on you?’ ‘No, not for a moment.’
Not for one moment did she think it was a trap.
not/never in a million years
used to say that it is completely impossible that something could ever happen
Dad will never agree to that – not in a million years!
at no time
used to emphasize that something never happened
At no time did anyone suggest that the drug was dangerous.
At no time were the prisoners mistreated.
never.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: used when you are very surprised by something
never.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: He’s never going to cycle all the way to Manchester!
Well I never! I wouldn’t have thought she was that old!
